Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Business Information\nWe also collect information about businesses and their representatives that engage with us such as EIN, TIN, contact person name, address, phone number, contact person email address, bank account information, and number of years in business (collectively, “Business Information”). This information is generally not considered Personal Information because it relates to a business or a business contact; however, to the extent we must treat any Business Information as Personal Information under applicable laws we will do so.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
Usage Data and Site Activity
We automatically collect information in connection with the actions you take on the Site (“Usage Data”). For example, each time you use the Site, we automatically collect the type of web browser you use, the type of device you use, your operating system, your Internet Service Provider, the pages you view, referring and exit pages, the date and time of your visit, and the number of clicks to, from, and within the Site, and the duration of your visits to the Site. If this information is capable of being associated with you, directly or indirectly, we treat it as Personal Information. If this information is not capable of being individually associated with you, we treat it as Usage Data.

Communication Recordings
We may record calls and retain the content of text messages or other written/electronic communications between you and us. By communicating with us, you consent to our recording and retention of communications.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
HOW WE COLLECT INFORMATION
Voluntary Disclosure
We may ask you to provide us with Personal Information and/or Business Information when you communicate with us (online or offline), make a purchase from us, enter into an agreement with us, and at other times.

Third-Party Data Sources
We may collect Personal Information directly or indirectly from third-party data sources such as data brokerages, marketing/advertising agencies, analytics firms, and government agencies (e.g., U.S. Census Bureau, U.S. Postal Service, state and local recording offices).

Cookies & Other Automated Tools
We use cookies (a small text file placed on your computer to identify your computer and browser) and other automated tools such as tracking pixels to improve the experience of the site and Services, such as saving your preferences from visit to visit to present you with a customized version of the Website. Many web browsers are initially set up to accept cookies.  You can reset your web browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent.  Instructions for how to manage cookies in popular browsers are available at: Internet Explorer, Firefox, Chrome, Safari (iOS), Safari (Mac), and Opera. However, certain features of the Site may not work if you delete or disable cookies.

We use the following types of cookies:

Session Cookies: Session cookies keep track of you or your information as you move from page to page within the Site and are typically deleted once you close your browser. For example, session cookies allow your online credit application to function properly.
Persistent Cookies: Persistent cookies reside on your system and allow us to customize your experience if you leave and later return to the Site. For example, persistent cookies may allow us to remember your preferences.
Advertising Cookies: Advertising cookies are used to learn more about you and advertise products/services that might interest you.
We employ software technology that enables us to track certain aspects of a user’s visit to the Site. This technology helps us better manage content on the Site by informing us what content is effective, how consumers engage with the Site, and how consumers arrive at and/or depart from the Site. The software typically uses two methods to track user activity: (1) “tracking pixels” and (2) “clear gifs.” Tracking pixels are pieces of executable code that are embedded in a web page that track usage activity including which pages are viewed, when they are viewed, and how long the pages are viewed. Clear gifs are tiny graphics with unique identifiers which are embedded in web pages and email messages that track whether or not a user has viewed a particular web page or email message. User activity information may be associated with additional information about a user’s session and Personal Information, if provided by the user.

If you arrive at the Site by “clicking through” from another website, then certain information about you that you provided to that other website, such as the terms you were searching on that led you to the Site, may be transmitted to us and we may use it. You should review the Privacy Policy of any website from which you reached the Site to determine what information was collected by that website and for what purpose(s) you agreed that website could use that information. We may retain information about you provided to us by other websites and will only use it in accordance with this Privacy Policy. Such information may be associated with other Usage Data or Personal Information.

Online Behavioral Advertising
We may work with third-party advertisers, search providers, and ad networks (“Advertisers”) to learn more about you and show you ads or other content that we believe would be relevant to you. Advertisers may collect and use information about your use of the Site or Services as well as other websites and services. These companies may use cookies and other online tracking technologies to collect and use your information. We and/or Advertisers may also append other data to the data collected by Advertisers to create an interest profile of individual users. We try to retain and analyze data in a way that anonymizes it, but it is possible that we may collect or use Personal Information as part of our online behavioral advertising activities. Our Privacy Policy does not cover any use of information that an Advertiser may collect from you. Advertisements may be shown via the Site or on third-party websites.

Social Media Widgets
The Site may include social media features, such as the Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn widgets. These features may collect information about your IP address and the pages you visit on our site as well as other Personal Information. A cookie may be set to ensure that a feature properly functions. Your interactions with features are governed by the privacy policies of the companies that provide them.


THIRD-PARTY PERSONAL INFORMATION COLLECTION ON SITE
Certain third parties collect Personal Information and/or Usage Data from users of our Site using automatic information collection tools such as cookies and tracking pixels. For example, social media companies and Google (through use of the reCAPTCHA feature) may collect Personal Information and/or Usage Data. The collection, use, and disclosure of Personal Information and/or Usage Data by these third parties is governed by their privacy policies.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: CHILDREN’S PRIVACY\nThe Site and Services are not intended for children under the age of 16 and we do not knowingly collect Personal Information from children under the age of 16. If we become aware that we have inadvertently received Personal Information from a child under the age of 16, we will delete such information from our records.
Label: Others

Text: Right to Know\nYou have the right to request twice per 12-month period that we provide you (i) the categories or specific pieces of Personal Information we collected about you; (ii) the categories of sources from which your Personal Information was collected; (iii) the business or commercial purpose for which we collected your Personal Information; (iv) the categories of Third Parties with whom we shared your Personal Information; and (v) the categories of Third Parties to whom we sold your Personal Information. We are not permitted to provide access to specific pieces of Personal Information if the Personal Information is sensitive or creates a high risk of potential harm from disclosure to an unauthorized person such as financial information, social security numbers, and driver’s license numbers.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI Collected

Text: Right to Know\nYou have the right to request twice per 12-month period that we provide you (i) the categories or specific pieces of Personal Information we collected about you; (ii) the categories of sources from which your Personal Information was collected; (iii) the business or commercial purpose for which we collected your Personal Information; (iv) the categories of Third Parties with whom we shared your Personal Information; and (v) the categories of Third Parties to whom we sold your Personal Information. We are not permitted to provide access to specific pieces of Personal Information if the Personal Information is sensitive or creates a high risk of potential harm from disclosure to an unauthorized person such as financial information, social security numbers, and driver’s license numbers.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI sold / shared

Text: To request access to your Personal Information and the information listed above, you may submit a request through our Right to Know (Access) request page or by calling us at 1-844-201-3013. This page has more information about how you can verify your identity or designate an authorized agent to submit a request on your behalf.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: Right to Deletion\nYou have the right to request that we delete any Personal Information we have collected about you. Please understand that we are not required to honor a deletion request if a legal exemption applies in instances where the information is needed to prevent security incidents or fraud, enable internal uses that are reasonably aligned with your expectations, or comply with legal obligations (e.g., a subpoena).
Label: Description of Right to Delete

Text: To request deletion of your Personal Information from our servers, you may submit a request through our Right to Deletion request page or by calling us at 1-844-201-3013.  This page has more information about how you can verify your identity or designate an authorized agent to submit a request on your behalf. We will notify our third parties of your request and ask that they delete your personal information as well.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: Right to Opt-Out from the Sale of Personal Information\nYou have the right to direct us not to sell your Personal Information to Third Parties.
Label: Description of Right to Opt-out of sale of PI

Text: You may exercise your Right to Opt-Out by submitting a request via our “Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information” request page or by calling us at 1-844-201-3013.  This page has more information about how you can verify your identity or designate an authorized agent to submit a request on your behalf.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: Right to Correct\nYou have the right to request a correction to your inaccurate personal information.
Label: Description of Right to Correct Information

Text: You may exercise your Right to Correct by submitting a request via our “Right to Correct request page” or by calling us at (844) 201-3013. This page has more information about how you can verify your identity or designate an authorized agent to submit a request on your behalf.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: Right of Restriction\nYou have the right to request that we limit the use of your sensitive personal information.
Label: Description of Right to Limit use of PI

Text: You may exercise your Right of Restriction by submitting a Do Not Sell request via our “Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information” request page or by calling us at (844) 201-3013. This page has more information about how you can verify your identity or designate an authorized agent to submit a request on your behalf.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: Authorized Agent\nIf you are an authorized agent submitting a request on behalf of a California resident, you must provide a copy of a lawful power of attorney or a written signed authorization from the consumer along with proof of your identity. You may provide this documentation via email to consumer@n-focus.com after submitting the request. We may contact you and the consumer on whose behalf you claim to act to verify your identity, the consumer’s identity, and your authorization to act on the consumer’s behalf.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: Non-Discrimination Notice\nWe will not discriminate against any consumer for exercising their privacy rights under law or this Privacy Policy.
Label: Description of Right to Non-discrimination on exercising rights

Text: California “Do Not Track” Disclosure\nDo Not Track is a web browser privacy preference that causes the web browser to broadcast a signal to websites requesting that a user’s activity not be tracked.  At this time, our Site and Services do not respond to “do not track” signals.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI Collected

Text:
ADDITIONAL VIRGINIA CONSUMER RIGHTS
If you are a resident of Virginia, you have additional rights to access and control your Personal Information, including a right to request that we disclose the Personal Information we collect, use, disclose, and sell, under the Virginia Consumer Data Protection Act. Exemptions may apply.

Right to Know
You have the right to request twice per 12-month period that we provide you (i) the categories of Personal Information we collected about you; (ii) the categories of sources from which your Personal Information was collected; (iii) the business or commercial purpose for which we collected your Personal Information; (iv) the categories of Third Parties with whom we shared your Personal Information; and (v) the categories of Third Parties to whom we sold your Personal Information.

To request access to your Personal Information and the information listed above, you may submit a request through our Right to Know (Access) request page or by calling us at 1-844-201-3013. This page has more information about how you can verify your identity or designate an authorized agent to submit a request on your behalf.

Right to Deletion
You have the right to request that we delete any Personal Information we have collected about you. Please understand that we are not required to honor a deletion request if a legal exemption applies such as if we need the information to complete a requested or reasonably anticipated transaction, prevent security incidents or fraud, enable internal uses that are reasonably aligned with your expectations, or comply with legal obligations.

To request deletion of your Personal Information and the information listed above, you may submit a request through our Right to Deletion request page or by calling us at 1-844-201-3013.  This page has more information about how you can verify your identity or designate an authorized agent to submit a request on your behalf.

Right to Opt-Out from the Sale of Personal Information
You have the right to direct us not to sell your Personal Information to Third Parties. You may exercise your Right to Opt-Out by submitting a request via our “Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information” request page or by calling us at (844) 201-3013.  This page has more information about how you can verify your identity or designate an authorized agent to submit a request on your behalf.

Right to Correct
You have the right to request a correction to your inaccurate personal information. You may exercise your Right to Correct by submitting a request via our “Right to Correct request page” or by calling us at (844) 201-3013. This page has more information about how you can verify your identity or designate an authorized agent to submit a request on your behalf.

Right Against Automated Decision-Making
We do not utilize automated decision-making.

Authorized Agent
If you are an authorized agent submitting a request on behalf of a Virginian resident, you must provide a copy of a lawful power of attorney or a written signed authorization from the consumer along with proof your identity. You may provide this documentation via email to consumer@n-focus.com after submitting the request. We may contact you and the consumer on whose behalf you claim to act to verify your identity, the consumer’s identity, and your authorization to act on the consumer’s behalf.

Non-Discrimination Notice
We will not discriminate against any consumer for exercising their privacy rights under law or this Privacy Policy.

Financial Incentive Notice
We do not offer financial incentives, price differences, or service differences related to the collection, retention or sale of personal information.

Virginia “Do Not Track” Disclosure
Do Not Track is a web browser privacy preference that causes the web browser to broadcast a signal to websites requesting that a user’s activity not be tracked.  At this time, our Site and Services do not respond to “do not track” signals.
Label: Others

Text:
Third-Party Data Sources
We may collect Personal Information directly or indirectly from third-party data sources such as data brokerages, marketing/advertising agencies, analytics firms, and government agencies (e.g., U.S. Census Bureau, U.S. Postal Service, state and local recording offices).
Label: Description of Right to Know PI Collected

Text: We use cookies (a small text file placed on your computer to identify your computer and browser) and other automated tools such as tracking pixels to improve the experience of the site and Services, such as saving your preferences from visit to visit to present you with a customized version of the Website
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
Cookies & Other Automated Tools
We use cookies (a small text file placed on your computer to identify your computer and browser) and other automated tools such as tracking pixels to improve the experience of the site and Services, such as saving your preferences from visit to visit to present you with a customized version of the Website. Many web browsers are initially set up to accept cookies.  You can reset your web browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI Collected

Text: However, certain features of the Site may not work if you delete or disable cookies.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI Collected

Text: Instructions for how to manage cookies in popular browsers are available at: Internet Explorer, Firefox, Chrome, Safari (iOS), Safari (Mac), and Opera.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text:
e use the following types of cookies:

Session Cookies: Session cookies keep track of you or your information as you move from page to page within the Site and are typically deleted once you close your browser. For example, session cookies allow your online credit application to function properly.
Persistent Cookies: Persistent cookies reside on your system and allow us to customize your experience if you leave and later return to the Site. For example, persistent cookies may allow us to remember your preferences.
Advertising Cookies: Advertising cookies are used to learn more about you and advertise products/services that might interest you.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: We employ software technology that enables us to track certain aspects of a user’s visit to the Site. This technology helps us better manage content on the Site by informing us what content is effective, how consumers engage with the Site, and how consumers arrive at and/or depart from the Site.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI Collected

Text: The software typically uses two methods to track user activity: (1) “tracking pixels” and (2) “clear gifs.” Tracking pixels are pieces of executable code that are embedded in a web page that track usage activity including which pages are viewed, when they are viewed, and how long the pages are viewed. Clear gifs are tiny graphics with unique identifiers which are embedded in web pages and email messages that track whether or not a user has viewed a particular web page or email message.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
The software typically uses two methods to track user activity: (1) “tracking pixels” and (2) “clear gifs.” Tracking pixels are pieces of executable code that are embedded in a web page that track usage activity including which pages are viewed, when they are viewed, and how long the pages are viewed. Clear gifs are tiny graphics with unique identifiers which are embedded in web pages and email messages that track whether or not a user has viewed a particular web page or email message. User activity information may be associated with additional information about a user’s session and Personal Information, if provided by the user.

If you arrive at the Site by “clicking through” from another website, then certain information about you that you provided to that other website, such as the terms you were searching on that led you to the Site, may be transmitted to us and we may use it. You should review the Privacy Policy of any website from which you reached the Site to determine what information was collected by that website and for what purpose(s) you agreed that website could use that information. We may retain information about you provided to us by other websites and will only use it in accordance with this Privacy Policy. Such information may be associated with other Usage Data or Personal Information.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI Collected

Text:
Online Behavioral Advertising
We may work with third-party advertisers, search providers, and ad networks (“Advertisers”) to learn more about you and show you ads or other content that we believe would be relevant to you. Advertisers may collect and use information about your use of the Site or Services as well as other websites and services. These companies may use cookies and other online tracking technologies to collect and use your information. We and/or Advertisers may also append other data to the data collected by Advertisers to create an interest profile of individual users. We try to retain and analyze data in a way that anonymizes it, but it is possible that we may collect or use Personal Information as part of our online behavioral advertising activities
Label: Description of Right to Know PI sold / shared

Text: Our Privacy Policy does not cover any use of information that an Advertiser may collect from you. Advertisements may be shown via the Site or on third-party websites.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI sold / shared

Text: The Site may include social media features, such as the Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn widgets. These features may collect information about your IP address and the pages you visit on our site as well as other Personal Information. A cookie may be set to ensure that a feature properly functions.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text:
Social Media Widgets
The Site may include social media features, such as the Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn widgets. These features may collect information about your IP address and the pages you visit on our site as well as other Personal Information. A cookie may be set to ensure that a feature properly functions. Your interactions with features are governed by the privacy policies of the companies that provide them.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI sold / shared

Text:
THIRD-PARTY PERSONAL INFORMATION COLLECTION ON SITE
Certain third parties collect Personal Information and/or Usage Data from users of our Site using automatic information collection tools such as cookies and tracking pixels. For example, social media companies and Google (through use of the reCAPTCHA feature) may collect Personal Information and/or Usage Data. The collection, use, and disclosure of Personal Information and/or Usage Data by these third parties is governed by their privacy policies.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI sold / shared
Description of Right to Know PI Collected

Text: PRIVACY POLICY CHANGES\nThis Privacy Policy is subject to change. We encourage you to review this Privacy Policy frequently for any revisions or amendments. Changes to this Privacy Policy will be posted on this Site and will be effective immediately upon posting
Label: Updated Privacy Policy

Text: Last Updated: 12/29/2022
Label: Updated Privacy Policy

Text: This Privacy Policy explains what information we collect about you, how we use or disclose such information, how to exercise any rights you may have with respect to your Personal Information (including any rights to opt-out of certain uses of your information), and the safeguards we have in place to reduce the risk of unauthorized access and use.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: This Privacy Policy explains what information we collect about you, how we use or disclose such information, how to exercise any rights you may have with respect to your Personal Information (including any rights to opt-out of certain uses of your information), and the safeguards we have in place to reduce the risk of unauthorized access and use.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text:
PRIVACY POLICY CHANGES
This Privacy Policy is subject to change. We encourage you to review this Privacy Policy frequently for any revisions or amendments. Changes to this Privacy Policy will be posted on this Site and will be effective immediately upon posting. You will be deemed to have been made aware of and have accepted the changes by your continued use of our Site or Services. If we determine that a change to this Privacy Policy will result in using your Personal Information acquired before the change being used in a materially new way, we will provide you notice before using your Personal Information in the new way.
Label: Updated Privacy Policy

Text:
INFORMATION WE COLLECT AS A BUSINESS
Personal Information
We collect information that personally identifies, relates to, describes, or is capable of being associated with you (“Personal Information”), including:
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected
Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
Business Information
We also collect information about businesses and their representatives that engage with us such as EIN, TIN, contact person name, address, phone number, contact person email address, bank account information, and number of years in business (collectively, “Business Information”). This information is generally not considered Personal Information because it relates to a business or a business contact; however, to the extent we must treat any Business Information as Personal Information under applicable laws we will do so.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
Usage Data and Site Activity
We automatically collect information in connection with the actions you take on the Site (“Usage Data”). For example, each time you use the Site, we automatically collect the type of web browser you use, the type of device you use, your operating system, your Internet Service Provider, the pages you view, referring and exit pages, the date and time of your visit, and the number of clicks to, from, and within the Site, and the duration of your visits to the Site. If this information is capable of being associated with you, directly or indirectly, we treat it as Personal Information. If this information is not capable of being individually associated with you, we treat it as Usage Data.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
Communication Recordings
We may record calls and retain the content of text messages or other written/electronic communications between you and us. By communicating with us, you consent to our recording and retention of communications.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
Voluntary Disclosure
We may ask you to provide us with Personal Information and/or Business Information when you communicate with us (online or offline), make a purchase from us, enter into an agreement with us, and at other times.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
Third-Party Data Sources
We may collect Personal Information directly or indirectly from third-party data sources such as data brokerages, marketing/advertising agencies, analytics firms, and government agencies (e.g., U.S. Census Bureau, U.S. Postal Service, state and local recording offices).
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
Cookies & Other Automated Tools
We use cookies (a small text file placed on your computer to identify your computer and browser) and other automated tools such as tracking pixels to improve the experience of the site and Services, such as saving your preferences from visit to visit to present you with a customized version of the Website.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: You can reset your web browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent.  Instructions for how to manage cookies in popular browsers are available at: Internet Explorer, Firefox, Chrome, Safari (iOS), Safari (Mac), and Opera. However, certain features of the Site may not work if you delete or disable cookies.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text:
We use the following types of cookies:

Session Cookies: Session cookies keep track of you or your information as you move from page to page within the Site and are typically deleted once you close your browser. For example, session cookies allow your online credit application to function properly.
Persistent Cookies: Persistent cookies reside on your system and allow us to customize your experience if you leave and later return to the Site. For example, persistent cookies may allow us to remember your preferences.
Advertising Cookies: Advertising cookies are used to learn more about you and advertise products/services that might interest you.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

This technology helps us better manage content on the Site by informing us what content is effective, how consumers engage with the Site, and how consumers arrive at and/or depart from the Site. The software typically uses two methods to track user activity: (1) “tracking pixels” and (2) “clear gifs.” Tracking pixels are pieces of executable code that are embedded in a web page that track usage activity including which pages are viewed, when they are viewed, and how long the pages are viewed. Clear gifs are tiny graphics with unique identifiers which are embedded in web pages and email messages that track whether or not a user has viewed a particular web page or email message. User activity information may be associated with additional information about a user’s session and Personal Information, if provided by the user.

Text: SENSITIVE PERSONAL INFORMATION WE COLLECT AS A SERVICE PROVIDER FOR OUR CLIENTS\nWhen acting on behalf of our clients as a service provider, we may collect, use, and disclose information that personally identifies, relates to, describes, or is capable of being associated with you (“Sensitive Personal Information”) for the purpose of servicing those clients. The specific categories of Sensitive Personal Information collected and how that Sensitive Personal Information is used or disclosed is determined by our clients and will vary, and may include:
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected
Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: When acting on behalf of a client, we supply that client with all information requested by them or consistent with their contract. This information is usually what is required to facilitate a specific transaction or donation but can vary depending on the client.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: If you request information about the Sensitive Personal Information we collect, use, and disclose on our clients’ behalf, we will direct you to contact the client(s).
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: We may disclose Personal Information and any other information about you to government or law enforcement officials or private parties if, in our discretion, we believe it is necessary or appropriate to respond to legal requests (including court orders, investigative demands and subpoenas), to protect the safety, property, or rights of ourselves, consumers, or any other third party, to prevent or stop any illegal, unethical, or legally actionable activity, or to comply with law.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: We may share Personal Information and Usage Data with businesses controlling, controlled by, or under common control with us. If we are merged, acquired or sold, or in the event of a transfer of some or all of our assets, we may disclose or transfer Personal Information and Usage Data in connection with such transaction.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: HOW LONG WE RETAIN YOUR DATA\nWe retain your Personal Information for as long as we have a relationship with you. We also retain your Personal Information for a period of time after our relationship with you has ended where there is an ongoing business need to retain it. This includes retention to comply with our legal, regulatory, tax, and/or accounting obligations. Generally, we retain Personal Information for approximately thirteen (13) months after our relationship with you has ended, but the term for which we retain your Personal Information may be longer or shorter.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Right to Know\nYou have the right to request twice per 12-month period that we provide you (i) the categories or specific pieces of Personal Information we collected about you; (ii) the categories of sources from which your Personal Information was collected; (iii) the business or commercial purpose for which we collected your Personal Information; (iv) the categories of Third Parties with whom we shared your Personal Information; and (v) the categories of Third Parties to whom we sold your Personal Information. We are not permitted to provide access to specific pieces of Personal Information if the Personal Information is sensitive or creates a high risk of potential harm from disclosure to an unauthorized person such as financial information, social security numbers, and driver’s license numbers.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI Collected

Text: Right to Know\nYou have the right to request twice per 12-month period that we provide you (i) the categories or specific pieces of Personal Information we collected about you; (ii) the categories of sources from which your Personal Information was collected; (iii) the business or commercial purpose for which we collected your Personal Information; (iv) the categories of Third Parties with whom we shared your Personal Information; and (v) the categories of Third Parties to whom we sold your Personal Information. We are not permitted to provide access to specific pieces of Personal Information if the Personal Information is sensitive or creates a high risk of potential harm from disclosure to an unauthorized person such as financial information, social security numbers, and driver’s license numbers.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI sold / shared

Text: To request access to your Personal Information and the information listed above, you may submit a request through our Right to Know (Access) request page or by calling us at 1-844-201-3013. This page has more information about how you can verify your identity or designate an authorized agent to submit a request on your behalf.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: Right to Deletion\nYou have the right to request that we delete any Personal Information we have collected about you. Please understand that we are not required to honor a deletion request if a legal exemption applies in instances where the information is needed to prevent security incidents or fraud, enable internal uses that are reasonably aligned with your expectations, or comply with legal obligations (e.g., a subpoena).
Label: Description of Right to Delete

Text: To request deletion of your Personal Information from our servers, you may submit a request through our Right to Deletion request page or by calling us at 1-844-201-3013.  This page has more information about how you can verify your identity or designate an authorized agent to submit a request on your behalf. We will notify our third parties of your request and ask that they delete your personal information as well.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: Right to Opt-Out from the Sale of Personal Information\nYou have the right to direct us not to sell your Personal Information to Third Parties.
Label: Description of Right to Opt-out of sale of PI

Text: You may exercise your Right to Opt-Out by submitting a request via our “Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information” request page or by calling us at 1-844-201-3013.  This page has more information about how you can verify your identity or designate an authorized agent to submit a request on your behalf.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: Right to Correct\nYou have the right to request a correction to your inaccurate personal information.
Label: Description of Right to Correct Information

Text: You may exercise your Right to Correct by submitting a request via our “Right to Correct request page” or by calling us at (844) 201-3013. This page has more information about how you can verify your identity or designate an authorized agent to submit a request on your behalf.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: Right of Restriction\nYou have the right to request that we limit the use of your sensitive personal information.
Label: Description of Right to Limit use of PI

Text: You may exercise your Right of Restriction by submitting a Do Not Sell request via our “Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information” request page or by calling us at (844) 201-3013. This page has more information about how you can verify your identity or designate an authorized agent to submit a request on your behalf.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text:
Non-Discrimination Notice
We will not discriminate against any consumer for exercising their privacy rights under law or this Privacy Policy.

Financial Incentive Notice
We do not offer financial incentives, price differences, or service differences related to the collection, retention or sale of personal information.
Label: Description of Right to Non-discrimination on exercising rights
